page.title: 07Little Oakley
page.content: The Oakleys derive their names from once having been large{Oak woods} although it is difficult to imagine this now.Little Oakley is full of interesting people and history,such as the{Oakley}family,who farm Burnthouse farm.Their family name shows just how long they have lived here,and old Mrs Oakley didn't know how long the family had lived there,always she thought! The{Old Rectory}was built in the 1700's with a wooden frame,but in 1770 was red brick faced;it is now a private residence. {Little Oakley Hall}is Grade II listed and has beautiful views over Hamford waters.The family farm 600 acres,growing wheat,barley,duran wheat,borage,apples,peas,and soft fruit(pick your own).The farm is now highly mechanized since labour costs are high in the area,especially docks.
